definition: to urge on a horse by patting its bottom/fig. to encourage/same as 拍馬屁|拍马屁, to flatter or toady
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to resort to bragging and flattering
flatterer/toady

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 当我讨上司欢心的时候，我是拍马屁。

sentences.english: Mentally strong people recognize that they don't need to please everyone all the time.
sentences.chinese: 内心强大之人深知随时溜须拍马毫无必要。
难道你没发现奉承拍马很有好处？

sentences.english: Ross: All right, so I don't know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.
sentences.chinese: 那我不知道“拍马屁”的意思，但余下的是对的。
他只是一个乐于拍马屁的人。

sentences.english: Licking the leaders'foots is also his strong point.
sentences.chinese: 给领导溜须拍马也是他的专长。

sentences.english: In many cases, it is possible that there are other employees who merit these advantages more than the brown-noser.
sentences.chinese: 可是，在情况下，的员工比拍马屁者更有好处。

sentences.english: If China doesn't step up, it's hard to think who could.
sentences.chinese: 如果中国不愿拍马来救，很难想象谁还能担此重任。

sentences.english: To seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior .
sentences.chinese: 用拍马屁和谄媚的态度来取悦，引起注意。

sentences.english: I believe some people are simply born with the talent of buttering up people.
sentences.chinese: 我相信有的人生来就有拍马奉承的本领。

sentences.english: But the latest headlines to mention her name have not been nearly as flattering.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最近有关她的新闻头条却远非溜须拍马。

sentences.english: He openly crawled to the boss.
sentences.chinese: 他公开地对老板拍马屁。

sentences.english: A flatterer's throat is an open sepulcher.
sentences.chinese: 拍马屁者的喉咙就是打开的坟墓。

sentences.english: Many despise those who are always trying to win the favour of their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 非常鄙视那些总是给老板溜须拍马的人。

sentences.english: Apple polishers are a pain in the neck to conscientious teachers.
sentences.chinese: 对于有良心的教师，拍马屁的学生实在讨厌极了。

sentences.english: Where there is a flatterer, there is also a fool.
sentences.chinese: 哪里有拍马屁的，那里就有傻瓜。

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to get on a horse/to mount
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
horse hindquarters/flattery/boot-licking
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
to flatter/to toady
to speed along
to shout
horseback
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
toady/bootlicker
to charge
equestrianism/horsemanship
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
